author: jochembrouwer
content: Hmm, but thinking about this, I actually don't think we run fork transition tests, because I think I have to run our test runner with a different flag. Let me figure out how to run those and cross-check for completeness that those fork transitions tests are in the release ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Ok, this is also a reminder for myself that I should update our test runner to ensure we run **ALL** tests. I have claimed before that we pass all fixtures but those were only for the Prague tests, not for the CancunToPragueAtTime15k config. (Currently running those)

Side-note, maybe for blockchain tests we want to start overhauling the network config format. We currently parse these "special" networks with a regex to figure out the config. Since the merge we have `XToYAtTimeZ` configs and before we had `XToYAtZ` where Z was a block number. I'm not sure if it's worth the effort though, but maybe in the future we want to tune these configs specifically for some specific timestamps / blocks (?)

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ok great, we pass all. However, I do not see any 4844 tests for the fork?

author: jochembrouwer
content: These are the CancunToPragueAtTime15k tests which we run. The only other fork in the fixtures is Prague

author: jochembrouwer
content: I'm mainly interested to see if we do this correct: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9249

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ahh I think https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1082 is not part of the fixture release yet

author: jochembrouwer
content: Small note regarding the Prague fork and updating the 4844 blob schedule params: if we update the blob update fraction, then this has direct impact on the blob gas price, and since we now increase the denominator this means the fee will go down significantly.
